properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winds will reach up to 90 kilometres per hour beginning overnight tonight. ### Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: ROAD DUST ADVISORY FOR BURNS LAKE AND HOUSTON. The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued road dust advisories because of high concentrations of coarse particulate matter that are expected to persist until there is precipitation or dust suppression. Levels tend to be highest around busy roads and industrial operations. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. Exposure is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-03-29T03:38:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-03-28T19:39:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1345188889.2019
Area: Bulkley Valley and The Lakes - southeast including Burns Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: DUST ADVISORY ISSUED FOR FORT ST. JOHN. The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Fort St. John due to high concentrations of particulate matter (PM10). This advisory remains in effect until further notice. Exposure to PM10 is particularly a concern for infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise near busy roads until the advisory is lifted. If you are experiencing symptoms such as continuing eye or throat irritation, chest discomfort, shortness of breath, cough or wheezing, follow the advice of your health care provider. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at www.bcairquality.ca. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-03-29T06:51:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2019-03-28T22:52:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2155125302.2019
Area: B.C. North Peace River
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The Town Of Stoughton
properties.Summary:

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Telephone Service Disruption Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: There is an incident that has affected telephone and cell phone communications in the area surrounding the Hamlet of Sangudo. The disruption of service extends approximately ten kilometres into the surrounding area. ### Severe damages have occurred to the telephone and cell phone communication system in the area of the Hamlet of Sangudo, up to a ten kilometre radius. The ability to call for emergency services through 9 1 1 will be compromised. The repairs are estimated to take several days before full restoration of services.
Expires: 2019-04-04T09:46:09-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Lac Ste. Anne County, 2019-03-28T09:44:29-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5660
Area: Lac Ste. Anne County
properties.Author: Lac Ste. Anne County

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Telephone Service Alert
properties.Summary:
Description: There is an incident that has affected telephone and cell phone communications in the Town of Mayerthorpe. Severe damage has occurred to the Telus building in the Hamlet of Sangudo which is also affecting 911 services within town and area. The damage is expected to take several days to repair and get fully operational again, but Telus has confirmed that this is priority at this time.
Expires: 2019-04-04T12:54:11-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Town of Mayerthorpe, 2019-03-28T12:53:28-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5661

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Northwesterly winds gusting as high as 80 km/h continue to create blizzard conditions in Naujaat, Rankin Inlet and Whale Cove. As the strong winds move eastward across the region, blizzard conditions are expected in Coral Harbour on Friday. Blizzard conditions should exit the region Friday night into Saturday. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-03-29T11:35:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-03-28T19:36:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0809514527.2019
Area: Rankin Region including Whale Cove, Naujaat, Coral Harbour
properties.Author: Environment Canada
